subject: Re: [junit] Re: how to force junit test methods to be run in certain order?
msgSnippet: This almost looks like the setUp() and tearDown() should be used in this case. public class SomeTest extends TestCase() { public void setUp() { register(); }
messageBody:
This almost looks like the setUp() and tearDown() should be used in
this case.

public class SomeTest extends TestCase() {
public void setUp() {
register();
}

public void testNothing() {}

public void tearDown() {
unregister();
logout();
}
}

Or maybe you'd want to do this:

public void testStuff() {
register();
unregister();
logout();
}

Just because you have a method in your TestCase doesn't always make it
a test. I agree that the tests should be independent of one another,
and either of these examples will give you that.

-shane

On Friday, October 11, 2002, at 02:44 PM, kentlbeck wrote:

> --- In junit@y..., "vicki_nitchiporouk" <vicki_nitchiporouk@y...>
> wrote:
>> It seems that I solved this problem by inserting numbers in the test
>> methods' names, i.e test1Register, test2Unregister, test3LogOut,
>> and so on. When I run my junit suite as a regular console program
>> the order of test methods is observed, but when I run JUnit suite
>> from ant test order is reversed. Any idea how can I force a proper
>> order of test method execution while running junit from ant? Thanks
>> very much for help!
>
> Your tests will be more valuable if you design them to be order-
> independent. You may have to change the domain design also, but you
> will most likely be pleased with the results.
>
> Kent
